programme.title: Deadly 60: Our Planet Matters
programme.desc: An exotic pet is something that is slightly different from your average cat, dog or hamster and is often an animal from a far-flung place. Steve has kept snakes, spiders and scorpions all his life and thinks it is a great way of learning about the natural world. The problems begin when those pets come from uncertain places. The illegal pet trade can result in animals being taken from the wild, with devastating consequences. In this episode, Steve runs through his tips for what we can all do to try and stop it.

programme.title: Deadly 60Our Planet Matters
programme.desc: The oil palm is a remarkable tree, with an incredibly diverse fruit that can be used for many different things - from shampoo and soap to toothpaste, crisps and chocolate. Unfortunately, the spread of this remarkable plant is leading to the destruction of the rainforests, particularly in Borneo and Sumatra. So what can we do? Firstly, learn where your food is coming from. Pay attention to the labels and look out for sustainable palm oil. We can’t get rid of palm oil altogether as it is in countless products, and many of the alternatives would be worse. But there are different ways of making palm oil, some of which will not completely destroy the forests. The next thing you could do is buy some forest for yourself. It is possible to fundraise, to get money to purchase a piece of perfect rainforest and protect it. So why not see if you can wash cars, and buy a piece of forest the size of your classroom, the size of your assembly hall, possibly even the size of your school. Finally, think about how you use wood and paper. Make sure you recycle and be sure to think about your impact on the world in every single thing you do. If we don’t, then rainforests could be condemned to history.

programme.title: Empire and MeA Newsround Special
programme.desc: De-Graft Mensah heads to Ghana, the country of his family’s heritage, to find out about the legacy of the British Empire on the country and its people. He visits Ghana’s capital, Accra, where he learns about life in the country today. De-Graft then heads to the coastal region, home to his family, where he discover the lasting impact left by the Transatlantic slave trade. In Kumasi, he discovers how Britain used violence to make a profit from the country, before returning to Accra to learn what modern Ghanaians think about the legacy of the Empire.

programme.title: GiggleQuiz
programme.desc:
Joining Gail and Keith for today's GiggleQuiz are the Lost Pirate and Ann Teak.

Keith finds an old stick under his desk, and Ann Teak gives her 'expert' opinion on what it is. Ann declares that the artefact must be a conductor's baton and demonstrates how to use it. Unbeknownst to Ann, the stick is actually a magic wand and waving it around causes Arthur's phone to turn into a pineapple. 

Throughout the third round, Ann Teak obliviously performs her own magic spells in the studio. She changes the Lost Pirate's telescope into a banana, Gail's new autobiography into a cabbage and Keith into a dog! As the quiz comes to a close, Ann finally realises what her 'baton' actually is and throws it away before it can cause any more problems.

programme.desc: In today’s episode, Maddie is out and about! She finds out how revolving doors can let lots of people in and out of buildings at the same time. Then she uses a special camera to show how a sensor at the top of an automatic revolving door spots us so it can start to turn.\n\nNext, Maddie heads to a neon sign workshop and uses her thermal imaging camera to see how glass is heated until it’s really, really hot. programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: "Fireman Sam" is an animated children's series about a friendly fireman, his fellow firefighters and other townspeople in the Welsh town of Pontypandy. Sam remains composed in any emergency and always offers assistance to anyone in need. When he is not putting out fires, he spends his spare time in his shed, where he makes devices such as a potato-picker assembled from bicycle parts and a machine capable of replacing the town's band. His catchphrase is "Great fires of London!" His colleagues are Fireman Elvis Cridlington, who aspires to be a rock star, Station Officer Basil Steele, the chief of Pontypandy Fire Station, Firefighter Penny Morris, the only female member of the brigade, and Auxiliary Fireman Trevor Evans, a West Indian fireman who is also the town's bus driver. Other characters include Dilys Price, who runs the local grocery store, Bella Lasagne, an absent-minded café owner, Sarah and James Jones, who are Sam's niece and nephew, and Norman Price, a boy who loves practical jokes and skateboarding. The original series of 32 episodes between 1987 and 1994 featured stop-motion animation. The latest series update in 2008 features computer-generated animation. It can be seen on Channel Five.

programme.desc: When Ty and the gang's rebellion begins to hinder D-Stroy and D-Structs' plans for domination, the bad guys figure out a way to track the rebels down.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: Flapjaw's landing gear is damaged by vicious Dyscrapadons so the Trux and Tools must try to repair him mid-air.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: D-Stucts and D-Stroy discover Ty and his rebel gang's plan, forcing them to use a similar dinortrux group to decoy as a zig to their zag.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: The Tools try to find a new route to the Ravine, but when they find the tunnels infested with hazardous drillipedes, Click-Clack must summon new reserves of strength to take them on.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: The Trus build a repair unit designed to fix Trux on the go, but when Skya gets stranded alone with a Trux in need, she may need to face a repair by herself.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: When a tool is in need of repair for the first time, the Trux discover that the part required for the fix can only be found in one place: at the bottom of the sea.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: When D-Stroy and D-Structs learn that Ton-Ton will attend the Ankylodump Games, they concoct a scheme to lure the Trux, separate them and crush Ty.

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: When Ty and the gang repair damaged Trux throughout the crater, D-Stroy and D- Structs charge Scrap-It with gathering up all the parts and scraps so the Trux no longer have the supplies to make fixes.

programme.desc: When the Trux and tools eat tainted ore, their vocal wiring seizes and they're unable to speak. Now it's a race to find a remedy before D-Structs and D-Stroy get to it first.(n)

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: When Trux and tools find themselves trapped inside a scrap canyon inhabited by a terrifying apex scrap predator, the Shredadon, they must figure out how to use its help to shred them a pathway out.(n)

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: After Ton-Ton bonds with a baby Dreadtrux, he wants to keep it until it practically eats all of the renegade base.(n)

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: When Garby accidentally leads D- Structs and D-Stroy to the location of the renegade base, the Trux find themselves out of options until a glimmer of hope turns up when they learn that the D-Bros have run out of purple ore.(n)

programme.desc: When Ty and the gang go on a mission to rescue the captured Revvit they find themselves in a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse designed by D-Stroy.(n)

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: Ty the T-Trux encounters Revvit the Reptool and the pair quickly bond. Together they unite a team of Dinotrux who are ready to take on the threat of the D-Structs.(n)

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: Revvit and his Reptool friends take a wander beyond their ravine and find themselves the prey of a flock of vicious Scrapadactyls. The Dinotrux team comes to their aid.(n)

programme.desc: The Reptools are in need of protection, so the Dinotrux construct a garage. While working on the project, the D-Structs began to meddle and create tension between the team.(n)

programme.title: Dinotrux
programme.desc: A pack of Scraptors take Ton-Ton and hold him captive within their hive in Scraptor Valley. Ty and the Dinotrux team come to rescue their friend.(n)
